title: Federated Noisy Client Learning (Fed-NCL)
summaries: propose __an FL framework__ including a [1] a data quality measurement (DQM) component and [2] a noise robust aggregation (NRA) component, for noisy clients environment to achieve [1] boosting accuracy, and [2] robustness in comparison with [1] FedAvg and [2] Trimmed mean
systemModel: $1$ central server, $C$ clients per round with $K$-class dataset
process 1): server sends global model to clients
process 2): clients measure local data quality [see 1. Data Quality Measurement] and do local training
process 3): clients send [1] data quality (${Q_t^{c}}^{CE}$ and ${Q_t^{c}}^{Dis}$) [2] data quantity ($N^c$) [3] trained local model ($\Theta_t^c$) to server
process 4): server does robust aggregation [see 2. Noise Robust Aggregation]
questions: standard FL methods ignore the noisy client issue
